file_content.text: Can't raise the boss on the holo. Let's hurry back to Fort Garnik, Captain. Got a bad feeling about this.
I'm ready to get out and flex my swinging arm. Let's go chop down some separatists!
Whoa, whoa, hey, hey! Give that to the boss!
I need to step up security around here. If Rogun sends somebody, I plan to be ready.
Captain, the Big Boom Run isn't a stroll on the beach. You'll need an edge to make it back alive.
This here's a SoroSuub SSK heavy blaster. It's cut for a quick draw and got a hair-trigger. I call it "Flashy."
Flashy's the first blaster I ever owned. I want you to have it.
Don't expect anything in return. I'm not that kind of woman.
You're getting too familiar.
I don't know what sort of men you're used to, but I was raised a gentleman.
Flashy can bulls-eye a savrip between the eyes five times before the critter even knows it's dead. Here, take it.
Like I always say, never look a free blaster in the barrel.
I'm grateful.
I'll breathe a lot easier knowing you're ready for anything.
Don't think anything of it. I feel bad you're even having to take this job.
If I take this, what'll you use in a fight?
Don't you need a blaster?
I can take care of business just fine with Hewie here.
I don't want your lousy hand-me-downs.
Keep your used junk.
Take it anyway, all right? I can't let a lady walk into danger unprepared.
I appreciate the thought, Corso. I'd better get moving.
Thanks for the gift.
Seems like you're getting sweet on me, farm boy.
Are you flirting?
Never met a lady like you before, Captain. Got a vested interest in keeping you spry and lively.
I don't need you to take care of me, tough guy.
I can look after myself.
I've seen that with my own eyes, but you don't have to do everything on your own.
No disrespect, Captain, but your blaster isn't worth the parts it's made of. Try mine, and you'll see.
Flashy will put an end to anybody who gets in your way. I recommend using it indiscriminately.
After all your praise, Flashy better be the greatest thing ever.
That's some buildup.
Thanks for the advice.
I'll test it out.
Best of luck, Captain. Don't get killed, all right?
Don't take any unnecessary chances out there. You're good, but this Big Boom Run is serious business.
Any tips you can offer to survive this craziness?
Got any advice?
If it was me, I'd just run and not stop for anything.
I'm not good, I'm the best. Haven't you figured that out?
You underestimate me.
I knew that the minute I laid eyes on you. That's why I worry.
I'll say this much--you've got more stones than an asteroid field.
I think your boss is trying to get me killed.
I don't trust Viidu.
Don't worry about Viidu, worry about this run.
The boss wants a word. He's not happy about you shooting up his warehouse.
Don't leave the boss in suspense about the separatist computer files. It's all he can talk about.
Hey, Captain. Can't wait to hear how things went with Reki.
You talk to Viidu. I'll secure this hangar and meet you at Fort Garnik, Captain.
Skavak stole my best blaster, but I guess it's not as bad as losing a whole starship. I feel for you, Captain.
How am I supposed to be a captain without a starship?
Well, this complicates things.
That's easy. Just keep calling yourself "Captain" and shoot anybody who disagrees.
That wasn't just a starship--it was my home.
Can't believe I'm stuck here!
You must feel like your wings have been clipped.
This is all your fault. You owe me a new starship.
Blast your sympathy.
Give me a break. I can't even afford a used escape pod!
Nice attitude. No wonder you don't have a copilot.
Listen, Skavak and I were working for a guy named Viidu. When he finds out Skavak's a separatist, he'll want revenge just like you.
Do yourself a favor and go talk to Viidu in Fort Garnik. I guarantee he'll help get your ship back.
Who exactly is this mysterious boss of yours? How can he help?
Tell me about Viidu.
Viidu is the "King of Cargo." There isn't a payload that comes to Ord Mantell that doesn't pass through him.
Forts tend to be full of people I prefer to avoid, kid.
Not a fan of military bases.
Not to worry. The Republic Army runs Fort Garnik, but they let the boss do as he pleases. He keeps their supply lines open.
I'll handle this myself.
Don't be like that. Skavak's gotta turn up eventually.
And what's your big plan? Running around in circles yelling Skavak's name?
Viidu's a smart guy with connections everywhere. If anybody can find your ship, it's him.
It couldn't hurt to look around the island, first.
I'll scout some on my own.
This island isn't much good for sightseeing. You'll get yourself killed awfully easy wandering into the wrong place.
All right, I'll visit Viidu.
If anything else goes wrong, I'm taking it out on you.
You'd better hope he can.
Hey. I'm sorry about what happened--you don't have to get mean.
I'm no pushover, Captain. Maybe instead of making threats you should do something useful.
I have to lock down this hangar, but I'll send Viidu a holo and tell him what's up.
Fort Garnik isn't far from here. I'll see you and Viidu there soon, Captain.
Ugh... feels like a gundark used my skull as a drum. Thanks for saving my hide, Captain.
Skavak helped those separatists get in here. He stabbed us in the back!
That scum stole my ship!
Everything is gone!
He took all the weapons, too. He and the separatists must have been planning this all along!
How did this happen?
Last thing I remember was Skavak sucker-punching me. Looks like he and his separatist buddies stole everything!
How could you not know he was working for the enemy?
Skavak's a separatist?
Skavak was one smooth customer. Now he has your ship and those weapons!
Hang on... where's Torchy? I don't believe this! Skavak stole my blaster!
Torchy's a genuine BlasTech ALT-25 with magnatomic adhesion grip and side-mounted rangefinder. She's too good for Skavak.
I'm surprised Skavak didn't steal the whole hangar.
That dirty thief.
No arguments there.
Forget your stupid blaster, what about my ship?
Your weapon doesn't matter.
He's not getting away with this! C'mon... c'mon... pick up, blast you!
Skavak! When I get my hands on you I'm gonna shove a thermal detonator right up your--
Aw, what's the matter, Corso? Did I hurt your feelings? Be thankful you're alive, kid.
Do you have any idea who you're messing with?
Be worried I'm not dead.
What makes you think I care?
Bring my ship back and I'll consider forgiving you.
You've got one chance, pal.
This rust-bucket handles like a drunken dewback, but I like it. You know the saying--finders keepers.
You're too young to own a ship like this. Be honest. You borrowed it from your parents, right?
I'm going to kill you, Skavak.
Plenty of women want me dead, sweetheart. You'll have to get in line.
Better men than you have tried--so forgive me for not trembling.
On behalf of Ord Mantell's glorious freedom fighters, I thank you for your blasters, your ship and a big laugh. Have a nice day.
Come on--at least let me make you a better offer.
Can't we make a deal?
This isn't over.
Turn back now.
It's no use--he cut the comm channel. He always was good at making an exit.
Captain, you there? It's Corso. We got trouble back at the hangar!
Is my ship alright?
What kind of trouble?
For now--but maybe not much longer!
I'm a little busy.
You got a blaster--figure it out!
I leave for a few minutes and everything goes nuts.
Incompetent idiots.
Hey, this isn't my fault!
Separatists are busting into the hangar! We're giving them a warm welcome, but we could use a hand!
Skavak, get over here! Help me seal this hangar door! Skavak? What are you--
Keep your blaster handy out there and you'll do fine.
Hey there. The name's Corso. Pleased to meet you.
Ever notice how a savrip's breath smells just like a speeder's exhaust port? Why you suppose that is?
That's gotta be the entrance to the separatist base up there. Hey, guards! Come here and say hello to my pal Hewie!
Dareg's command center must be down on the upper level. You ready for some real fun, Captain?
Let's head for Coruscant. Skavak has a lot to answer for.
